New Records: Manny Machado tied Nate Colbert as the Padres' all-time home run leader with 163 home runs.
Key Match Events: Manny Machado hit two home runs in the Padres' 5-1 victory over the Giants.
Michael King pitched six innings of one-run ball.
The Padres' bullpen secured the final three innings without their three highest-leverage arms.
Post-Match Reflections: Manny Machado expressed honor in tying the home run record and doing it in front of the home crowd.
Padres manager Mike Shildt commented on Machado's perseverance and impact on the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres extended their lead for the top National League Wild Card spot to 1.5 games over the Diamondbacks.
The Padres moved within four games of the Dodgers in the NL West with 19 games remaining.
Rookie Jackson Merrill suffered a left patella contusion but X-rays were negative.
